conditional-visibility.setting.autoSteal: [This is system dependent] On supported game systems, set the 'hidden' sense/condition on a token's 'stealth' roll. NOTE: Is very hard to make the auto stealth work with other modules like token action hud, LMRTFY or similar module in a multisystem environment without specific hooks, so now i just rendered the result roll on the chat message and hope everything is working like expected, so if no chat is been rendered on the client side no stealth effect is applied and you are force to use the token hud feature.
conditional-visibility.setting.autoSkill: Auto apply effect for pre configured skills

[This is system dependent] On supported game systems, set the pre configured sense/condition on token's pre configured skills like 'stealth' and 'perception' roll. NOTE: Is very hard to make the 'auto skills' to work with other modules like 'token action hud', 'LMRTFY' or similar module in a multisystem environment without specific hooks, so now i just rendered the result roll on the chat message and hope everything is working like expected, so if no chat is been rendered on the client side no stealth effect is applied and you are force to use the token hud feature.
Skip dialog confirmation for 'Auto apply pre configured skills'
Make sense only with module setting 'Auto apply effect for pre configured skills' enabled, it will skip the dialog confirmation, is not advisable to disable this.
conditional-visibility.setting.autoPerce: [This is system dependent] On supported game systems, set the 'perception' condition on a token's 'perception' roll. NOTE: Is very hard to make the auto 'perception' work with other modules like token action hud, LMRTFY or similar module in a multisystem environment without specific hooks, so now i just rendered the result roll on the chat message and hope everything is working like expected, so if no chat is been rendered on the client side no stealth effect is applied and you are force to use the token hud feature.
conditional-visibility.setting.autoPassi: [This is system dependent] On supported game systems, if checked it will apply the flag 'Use Stealth Passive' by default on the token when is created created. Is advisable to set to false'
conditional-visibility.setting.useEagleE: A embedded version of the module https://github.com/trioderegion/eagle-eye/, but is abandoned for now
conditional-visibility.setting.reset.hin: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
conditional-visibility.setting.debug.lab: Prints debug messages to the console
conditional-visibility.setting.passivePe: [This is system dependent] Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each actor's passive perception. For example, in D&D5e system, each actor's passive perception is stored in the item's "actor.data.data.skills.prc.passive" attribute, so you'd put "data.skills.prc.passive" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.passiveSt: [This is system dependent] Make sense only with 'Auto hide on stealth rolls' or 'Auto check with passive perception' setting set to true. Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each actor's passive stealth. For example, in D&D5e system, each actor's passive stealth is stored in the item's "actor.data.data.skills.ste.passive" attribute, so you'd put "data.skills.ste.passive" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.activeSte: [This is system dependent] Make sense only with 'Auto hide on stealth rolls' setting set to true. Here you can configure what the attribute path is for each actor's passive stealth. For example, in D&D5e system, each actor's active stealth is stored in the item's "actor.data.data.skills.ste.total" attribute, so you'd put "data.skills.ste.total" in this setting.
conditional-visibility.setting.idStealth: Id of the attribute used from the system for the stealth

conditional-visibility.setting.idLangSte: The lang key of the attribute used from the system for the stealth skill

conditional-visibility.setting.enableRef: Every time there is a change on the CV data of the token we made a refresh of the sight layer, so you can avoid the unselect+select again event
conditional-visibility.setting.autoCheck: If enabled this module settings will apply on the checker the same behaviour given from the active effect change 'ATCV.conditionElevation' setted at 'true' by default.
conditional-visibility.setting.npcType.h: Here you can configure what the type of NPC actor of your system for the sight check. For example, in D&D5e system, the type is on the property "actor.type" an is value is 'npc', so you'd put "npc" in this setting.

conditional-visibility.effects.blinded.d:
A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

conditional-visibility.effects.darkvisio: A monster with Darkvision can see in the dark within a specific radius. The monster can see in dim light within the radius as if it were bright light, and in Darkness as if it were dim light. The monster can't discern color in Darkness, only Shades of Gray. Many Creatures that live Underground have this Special sense.

conditional-visibility.effects.tremorsen: A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures. Many burrowing creatures, such as ankhegs and umber hulks, have this special sense.

conditional-visibility.effects.seeinvisi: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

conditional-visibility.effects.blindsigh:
A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius.
Creatures without eyes, such as grimlocks and gray oozes, typically have this special sense, as do creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons.
If a monster is naturally blind, it has a parenthetical note to this effect, indicating that the radius of its blindsight defines the maximum range of its perception.

conditional-visibility.effects.truesight: A monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.

Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.

conditional-visibility.effects.greaterda: A creature with darkvision or greater darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level darkness spell, block normal darkvision. A creature with greater darkvision, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

conditional-visibility.effects.seeinvisi: You can see any objects or beings that are invisible within your range of vision, as well as any that are ethereal, as if they were normally visible. Such creatures are visible to you as translucent shapes, allowing you easily to discern the difference between visible, invisible, and ethereal creatures. The spell does not reveal the method used to obtain invisibility. It does not reveal illusions or enable you to see through opaque objects. It does not reveal creatures who are simply hiding, concealed, or otherwise hard to see.

conditional-visibility.effects.blindsens: A creature with blindsense notices things it cannot see. The creature usually does not need to succeed at Perception checks to pinpoint the location of a creature within range of its blindsense ability, provided that it has line of effect to that creature. Any opponent the creature with blindsense cannot see still has total concealment from the creature, and the creature still has the normal miss chance when attacking foes that have concealment. Visibility still affects the movement of a creature with blindsense. A creature with blindsense is still denied its Dexterity bonus to Armor Class against attacks from creatures it cannot see.

conditional-visibility.effects.scent.des: This special sense allows a creature to detect approaching enemies, sniff out hidden foes, and track by sense of smell. Creatures with the scent ability can identify familiar odors just as humans do familiar sights. The creature can detect opponents within 30 feet by sense of smell. If the opponent is upwind, the range increases to 60 feet; if downwind, it drops to 15 feet. Strong scents, such as smoke or rotting garbage, can be detected at twice the ranges noted above. Overpowering scents, such as skunk musk or troglodyte stench, can be detected at triple the normal range. When a creature detects a scent, the exact location of the source is not revealed—only its presence somewhere within range. The creature can take a move action to note the direction of the scent. When the creature is within 5 feet of the source, it pinpoints the source’s location.

conditional-visibility.dialogs.title.war: Stop immediately! Thinking of doing a stealth roll right? Well you can't do it from here! this is a generic tool for applying active 'sense' and 'condition' effects on tokens. Stealth shooting can be done in many ways from the character sheet, with TAH, with LMRTFY, with MTB, with DAE + Item Macro, but not with this form. The form uses the stealth values as a basis for applying a value for the AE you select in the dropdown and does nothing else, stop thinking that what you shoot here is a 'stealth' roll.
